intro: Microtoena griffithii, commonly known as the Indian mountain sorrel, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Geraniaceae. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in high-altitude regions of the Himalayas. The plant features small, alternate leaves with a distinctive heart-shaped base and produces clusters of tiny, pinkish-white flowers. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or alpine soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
